issue.summary: 5S rDNA cluster underrepresented
issue.status_text: CH17-275P10 is in active finishing at MGI. Sanger accession for draft version of CH17-275P10: FO393394 Alignment of NR_023363.1 suggests this draft sequence represents 19 copies of the 5S rDNA cluster. By alignment, the clone spans the GRCh38 assembly gap between AL139288.15 and AL813899.14. Further analysis of OM data suggests FO393394.4 is collapsed (missing ~39kb of sequence).
issue.description: The 5S rDNA cluster, located at 1q42.11-q42.13, is likely grossly underrepresented in the reference assembly in component AL713899.14 (RP4-621O15).
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Potential inversion in GRCh38 component AC092815.2 may affect alignment of PTPRF (Gene ID:109633040)
issue.description: Potential inversion in GRCh38 component AC092815.2 may affect alignment of PTPRF (Gene ID:109633040)
issue.resolution_text: This inversion occurs at GRCh38 coordinates NC_000001.11:43,593,626-43,594,262 (637bp) in component AC092815.2. AC255393.1 (CH17-319G7) shows the inversion haplotype, also identified by estd197 (McKernan et al. 2009) and estd19 (Ahn et al. 2009). Since this inversion haplotype has no consequence on gene annotation/function, an ALT_LOCI containing the inversion haplotype (AC255393.1 (CH17-319G7)) will not be created.

issue.summary: GeneID: 731656 (LOC731656), assembly gap, chromosome
issue.description: NR_027454.1 aligns to HuRef and Celera but not to the reference assembly. Based on the HuRef assembly, the RefSeq likely falls in a gap on the reference assembly between CR589906.2 and BX470108.3. It appears that HuRef contigs ABBA01033113.1, ABBA01033114.1, and ABBA01033115.1 could be used to fill the gap.
issue.resolution_text: This issue is a duplicate of issue HG-541. Please see Jira issue HG-541 for all future updates regarding this issue

issue.summary: AL513482.13 contains a misassembly

issue.description: AL513482.13 contains a misassembly
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: GeneID: 284654 (RSPO1), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: Discrepancy (indel) between genomic clone AL513220.9 and transcripts for RSPO1 (GeneID: 284654)
issue.resolution_text: Mini contig KF573688.1 has been built and added to the TPF to update the reference sequence at this position for GRCh38.

issue.summary: GeneID: 9554 (SEC22B), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_004892.4 retains a mismatch at nt 255: C vs genomic T compared to the AL359758.15 component
issue.resolution_text: With the addition of HG1292_patch, GeneID:9554 (SEC22B) now has sufficient alignment in the Reference sequence to component AC245008.1.

issue.summary: FCGR2C gene transcript sequence disagrees with clone sequence
issue.status_text: This discrepancy is caused by known variation. The allele to be represented in the reference genome will be decided once a definition of "common" allele is reached.
issue.description: GRCh37 contains the non-coding allele for FCGR2C. This is a known polymorphism.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: GeneID: 261734 (NPHP4), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: Nt 122370 of NG_011724.1, which corresponds to the intronic splice acceptor preceding nt 3084 (exon 21) of NM_015102.2, represents a rare polymorphism (rs1287637).
issue.resolution_text: WGS contig KF459609.1 has been generated and uploaded to the Chr.1 TPF, fixing this base for GRCh38

issue.summary: GeneID: 84722 (PSRC1), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_001032291.2 aligns to AL390252.9 with GT-GG splice sites at nt 106^107. The GG acceptor corresponds to SNP rs643457 at NC_000001.10:109825360. Celera, HuRef, and almost all individuals assayed have an AG acceptor.
issue.resolution_text: WGS contig KF459601.1 has been generated and uploaded to the Chr.1 TPF, fixing this base for GRCh38

issue.summary: GeneID: 649330 (LOC649330), many placements, none good
issue.description: NM_001146181.1 is supported by two RT-PCR clones (BC171859.1 and BC171865.1). Its best hit to GRCh37 is on AL022101.1 at only 96% identity at the location of GeneID: 343069, but it has a perfect and nearly full-length match to HuRef ABBA01179502.1 and Celera AADB02139973.1. It looks like this gene is missing from GRCh37.
issue.resolution_text: NM_001146181.1 now has an alignment to AC245056.3 (CH17-409J4) which is part of the CH17 pathway described in HG-1342

issue.summary: GeneID: 127343 (DMBX1), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_147192.2 doesn't align correctly, the intron should be at 169^170 with GT-CG splice sites vs. GRCh37, Celera, and HuRef. The 'C' at NC_000001.10:46976131 is reported as a C/T SNP (rs76343542), which would make for a known non-consensus splice site GT-TG.
issue.resolution_text: 1000 genomes data shows that GRCh37represents the major (C) allele here, so no update is necessary.

issue.summary: gaps and duplications in pericentromeric region involving PDE4DIP gene
issue.description: A missing 3' exon of the PDE4DIP gene suggests assembly issues in this pericentromeric region.
issue.resolution_text: With the completion of the CHORI-17 1q21 pathway, another copy of the PDE4DIP gene, containing a separate last exon, has been localized to component AC245297.4 (HG-1287/JH636052).

issue.summary: GeneID: 100132074 (FOXO6), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: FOXO6 (GeneID:100132074) XM_002342102.1 is the ortholog of mouse Foxo6 (BC086628.1). The reference BAC AC093151.2 has a frameshift compared to mouse, at 133874 (mouse has an additional 200 nt segment).
issue.resolution_text: FO681542 has been added onto the TPF to correct a 200nt deletion found in FOXO6 (GeneID:100132074) XM_002342102.1

issue.summary: GeneID: 149086 (LOC149086), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: BC036357.1 aligns as 8 exons to HuRef and Celera, but the first 5 exons are missing from GRCh37 AC114494.2.
issue.resolution_text: AC209007.3 (ABC9-41296000J2) has been inserted as a contained clone to represent the approximately 8kb of sequence that is absent from NC_000001.10, due to a deletion in AC114494.2.

issue.summary: FIX patch for Chr.1 Gap Problem Region #2 (left side)
issue.description: There is assembly gap between CR589904.4 and AL672296.5. This gap was originally described in HG-34. An extension into this gap from the left side is being considered for patch release. A proposed FIX patch extension from the right side is described in HG-1409.
issue.resolution_text: An extension from the left side of this gap since GRCh37 was released as a FIX patch: GL383516.1
